gcci.text: At a prevailing spot price of about $3.20 per H100‑hour, even modest deployments translate to multi‑million‑dollar annual GPU opex, making forward capex commitments and diversified sourcing essential to navigate ongoing supply constraints.

gtpi.text: An average input token price around $1.38 per million is compressing margins and catalyzing a price war that favors vendors who achieve higher tokens‑per‑dollar through distillation, quantization, and long‑context optimization.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load equates to roughly 13.7 GW continuous, stressing grids and amplifying the carbon‑intensity debate unless AI facilities accelerate firm‑power procurement, including nuclear and long‑duration storage.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment is cautiously buoyant, with operators emphasizing efficiency and sustainability to mitigate bubble risks and support durable, multi‑year growth.
